text:
発表会だ学芸会だと言っても実際に人様の前で演じる以上は少しでもいいものをと皆必死に練習したりもしたよね。 お互いに出来ないことをアドバイスし合ったり衣装の相談をしたり。
そして迎える当日は本当に兄弟や従兄弟の舞台を見守る気持ちでハラハラしながら見ていたっけ。
それだけに無事終わった時の喜びや達成感は半端ないものだった。 スタジオに庭があったらキャンプファイヤーでもやりたいような気分。
trans:
I say a school concert or a school arts fair, but actually, more than performing in front of other people, it was things like desperately practicing something with everyone, no matter how small it was. Advising each other on things we couldn't do ourselves, or discussing the costumes.
And then on the day itself, watching the stage anxiously, really feeling like you're keeping an eye on your siblings or your cousins up there.
That's precisely why the joy and the sense of accomplishment was so overwhelming once they'd finished safely. If there was a garden at the studio, I'd feel like having a campfire there.
